en:
Peitho (labelled) standing near frontal, with her weight on her left
      leg, and her head profile to the left, wearing a peplos belted over a long overfold, black
      fibulae on her shoulders, her hair tied in a bun, holds up a branch in her left hand, and
      holds her slightly bent right arm at her side; a nude, bearded Menelaos (labelled), running
      3/4-view to the right, with his left leg advanced, wearing a helmet, and a patterned chlamys
      and shield on his bent left arm, as well as a scabbard on his left hip, attached to a band
      over his right shoulder, holds his straight right arm behind his body, where a sword has just
      fallen from his opened right hand; a small, nude Eros, flying profile to the right, holds a
      small white garland (fugitive) out to Menelaos; Aphrodite (labelled), standing frontal, with
      her weight on her right leg, and her head profile to the left, wearing a himation over a
      button-sleeved chiton with shoulder straps, and a kekryphylon, holds in her left arm her
      himation over her shoulder, and with her right arm wraps her himation in front of her body;
      Helen (labelled), running 3/4-view to the right, with her head profile to the left, and her
      weight on her forward, bent left leg, wearing a peplos fastened with black fibulae, her hair
      in a bun, but also cascading from the sides, raises slightly both arms bent, the fingers of
      her right hand spread, palm out, and the left hand reaching behind the shield of the cult
      statue of Athena Promachos, standing profile to the left on a four-step base, wearing a belted
      peplos, a Corinthian helmet, a shield on her left arm, holding a spear diagonally in her
      upraised right hand.

<bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 7.244 s.v. Peitho no. 5 (N. Icard-Gianolio);
      <bibl>Shapiro 1993</bibl>, 192, 250 no. 130, fig. 150;
      <bibl>Add2</bibl>, 339; <bibl>Boardman 1989a</bibl>, fig. 309;

      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 4.543 s.v. Helene no. 272bis, pl. 340 (L. Kahil/N. Icard);
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 2.121 s.v. Aphrodite no. 1259 (A. Delivorrias), 969 s.v. Athena
      no. 112 (P. Demargne); <bibl>Walter 1971</bibl>, 182 fig. 164; Brommer, VL 3.407 B
      13; <bibl>Para</bibl>, 460; <bibl>Hamdorf 1964</bibl> 118 no. 483b; E.

      91-92 pl. 30.1-3; Helbig4 1.977 (H. Sichtermann); <bibl>EAA</bibl> 4 (1961) 1021

      (A. Comotti), fig. 356; <bibl>Stella 1956</bibl>, 750; Ghali-Kahil 1955, 90-91 no.
      72 pl. 66.1-3; <bibl>Rumpf 1953</bibl>, pl. 34.4; <bibl>Dugas

      Bildwerke (Stuttgart 1857) pl. 26; Museum Etruscum Gregorianum (Rome 1842) 2 pl.
      5.2.
